column1:
Minifig290,"2018-08-25T17:59:16.183Z","No.1 Waste of money set of 2017","

Well hello there, Today i&rsquo
column2: m going to have a look at all 35 of the wave 2 Nexo&nbsp
column3: Power blind bags. retailing at a eye watering &pound
column4: 3 or $4 for just 10 parts per blind bag giving a Price Per Part of a shocking 30p or 40c per bag.

column1: Included in each pack are 5 different Nexo
column2: Powers in 5 different colours and a Holder for 3 powers

column1: Lets look at the money incinerator lego set :)

To go with 5 powers is a stand that uses 5 elements. The main part is a triangular plate with a technic sized hole through the centre, the part can hold only 3 of the 5 powers in each pack which is ludicrous to me. Also there&rsquo
column2: s a connector which is built out of 2x2 dark blue tile (which is the
column3: most useful part to be honest) on top of 2 1x2 plates with clips on 1 side in light gray on top of a 2x2 rounded inverted trans neon orange plate.

column1: The connectors are connected to one of the 3 minifig sized bars on the massive 3 holder thingy.
The 35 powers are in 5 colour groups: Trans Red, Trans Blue, Trans Green, Trans Clear and Trans Yellow. I look at each shield in its colour
column3: ll name the design printed onto it. Let&rsquo

column1: Figure with a ring of spikes on top
Bubbly soap bar with a stink on top
Dragon (same as green dragon) but with a circle behind it
Quarter of the world with the suns rays behind
Knights head with cobweb coming out of the bottom
A knight bot holding a freshly baked pie
A knight on a podium of winners
lastly a tooth with a explosive sting coming out.
Well one word to sum ignoring up a waste of £
column2: 3 or $4 only a few of the shields are good and recognisable where as a lot are unrecognisable.
